I absolutely agree with this idea. There are those ‚Äúmod packs‚Äù for bedrock edition with add-ons, but they are infuriating to play without recipes showing up, and no bedrock alternative to Jei.

I agree with you, addon makers should have control over the recipe book. In fact to me it's the other way round: i want to disable it completely or disable some of my custom crafting recipes so they do not show up in the recipe book. Since i specifically want addon users to have to learn those recipes by heart.

I intend to use custom blocks in those recipes I want hidden - is it still true that minecraft bedrock won't show them in the recipe book? although that is (like the poster of this thread points out) maybe not the intended way for it to work, this behavior would actually solve my problem.
I want a toggle for this too, new one is irritating for older players and really hurts instincts. Im not playing anything with it until either a mod fixes it or a toggle is added.
Even more so because the smooth transition causes troubles for some that wish to speed bridge in later editions.
i agree

it makes me genuinely motion sick. I'm stuck having to play on older versions and it sucks not being able to join my friends on the newer servers.

Good idea for shared devices
This is one of the quality of life changes that would so useful. This one would come in super handy if you shared your device with a younger sibling, for example.
I constantly accidentally join my modded world on vanilla and have to use a back-up
I agree, this would be a good feature for the game, especially for people who have curious siblings that can start trouble in your world.
Hi
Love it, it's much cleaner!

Please make the old "You Died" screen option a permanent change. I understand that Minecraft Bedrock is making the switch to become more modern, but many players, including myself, still appreciate the old death screen.
My 8 year old boy Ben HATES IT. But beyond 'it's different' cannot explain what specifically he hates, why he hates it, or what changes he would like to see you make so that he won't hate it...
it doesnt work for me and where is renderdragon?
I like that, but it would also be helpful if there was some way to find where you died. Something that helps find it to get stuff back.

I really like the new "You Died" screen, however, we still need the ability to access the Chat when we die. When we die right now, we can still open chat and talk to people on n SMP, and see our coordinates at the top of the Chat Box. On the new screen, we have no ability to get into chat or see the coordinates of where we died.

This feature is totally useless, because even if you have a simple resource pack enabled, it won't work. Please if you're going to make it official, make it possible to use resource packs with it too.
I would like to be able to make TNT duping machines
Since this update, the app keeps crashing,game keeps freezing for a couple seconds continuously, also lag is worse as well

I love it! I wish I could use it while having add-ons enabled, like global resources for example.

Like the other user said, I also feel like "game menu" should be in bold and capital, so it's consistent with the "RESPAWN" one

I would like it, if coordinates are turned on at the time, that they *stay* on-screen even after death. I cannot *TELL* you how many times I've died and I can't find my way back to get my things. -_-*

hello. Anyways i like the new death screen, It didnt really need to be changed but in this case it didnt hurt to have a nice refresh of some things. The option to keep the old death screen in the settings i feel like would be nice to keep around aswell. I like it so far and havent had any bugs relating to it. Thank you.

It‚Äôs cool, but instead of making the game look slightly better, you should add a dead zone slider for console. Dead zone is the amount of distance you have to move the stick before it registers movement. This setting is essentially in all games with a sensitivity slider and I have no clue why it‚Äôs not already in this game. On PlayStation there is no deadzone and on Xbox it is way to large and takes away all precision for pvp, placing blocks, shooting arrows, and anything that takes precision . For PlayStation players, without this slider stick drift becomes a real issue and makes the game unplayable. A slider would fix both issues. This a simple settings for controller that should have always been in the game.
I don't think this new screen is that necessary i liked the old death screen better üò≠ I don't I need to know how I died cuz it says so in the chat üò¢üò¢
It looks really nice but you should add a spot on the map to show where you died so it will be easier to find you items instead of losing all the items in your inventory
It looks really nice but you should add a spot on the map to show where you died so it will be easier to find you items instead of losing all the items in your inventory
It looks terrible, but I wouldn't mind... if the option to change back to the original was still available. Why the hell would you get rid of that? That's completely unacceptable, you need to fix it

Very reasonable, but I ask to myself, how will PSVR2 users be viewed from another player's perspective, whether it's in a different way rendering the arms moving, as with most VR games, or will it reflect Minecraft actions (just moving the camera, interacting with blocks, attacking, etc.) and will the Living Room, this one existed because you only needed DualShock 4 controllers to play with it, exist?
Seriously how could they've not put it in the first place?? It's so damn basic...
Honestly this will make camera switching less time-consuming, allowing you to take pictures of your world with your avatar faster.
I think this would be really really really great! I had basically had the same idea but there would be an extra slot for shulker boxes, bundles and elytras so you can fly with a chestplate.
Brilliant--you could do something similar with bundles and/or the Ender chest potentially too.
It shouldn‚Äôt replace the main inventory imo, but instead open a side menu. BTW It crazy I just thought about this general idea and came to wrote about it but then I saw you did already haha.

I had a similar idea about placing the shulker box in the off hand. My idea utilizes the function that allows tool switching from main hand to off hand. If the shulker box is in the offhand and the player activated the tool switching key stroke or button, instead of switching the shulker box to the main hand its content replaces the main inventory of the player. Until the shulker box is removed or the switch command is given, anytime the player access their inventory they see the shulker box content. Also if the player has named the shulker box the name shows up on the interface so the player knows they are viewing the shulker box and not main inventory. As the OP suggested, the hot bar should stay as the player has set it yet be able to bring content from the shulker box down to it.

 

This should also work with Ender chests as well.
Why is this not a function in the game?

This feels like it needs to be added when they finally push the bundle through. Whether it's this or something similar. I just imagined offhanding shulkers to be used as a way to auto pick up drops until full. Make it an expensive item craft if it shouldn't be easily available. Bundle + Shulker Box + Netherite = unbreakable backpack type thingy.

Given that the last comment was Sept of 24.

I've noticed the recipe toggle is bound to 2 keys (on PS5 console), L2 and R2.  Why not bind one, L2 for instance, to open the contents of a shulker (or bundle) as an inventory sub-menu.  Should be possible whether it's in another chest or your own inventory.  The code already exists in-game so toggling the contents shouldn't be a problem and I don't see why that couldn't work cross-platform.

Solves a few problems:

1 - Inventory management itself

2 - Prevents shulkerboxs from ending up in someone elses inventory when picked up

3 - Outright theft of it's contents

I think instead of that, we should have a tutorial world for Java, similar to the one in Bedrock. And a detailed walkthrough of potion making including what ingredients do what, where to find them, and the importance of brewing in the right order.
It is so difficult to remember all the recipes, you have to quit the game and enter in the minecraft wiki. So annoying.

I don't understand why they dont implement this already, honestly. I don't think it'd be hard.. It'd be just like the normal crafting book. It'd show you what steps to do, if you have the ingridents and click on the potion, it puts it in the stand to start brewing it. Then you click it again for next step to really finish it

You used to be able to force antialiasing in the graphics control panel however as of Minecraft 1.7 they started using framebuffer objects which in OpenGL require special programming to implement antialiasing.  If your graphics card driver has a postprocess AA mode like FXAA you can use that.
yeah i hate having to use mods to get a function that every other game has built-in, they really need to add this one
I would like if they added MSAA or SMAA officially to Minecraft Java.
Minecraft bedrock already have MSAA why Java edition don‚Äôt or TAA (I prefer it)

This is a really neat idea! I think it'd be even cooler if it wasn't just limited to items, and you could put down NPCs, too. So like, you could document what you need to cure a zombie villager in picture form, or something similar to that.
Really like this idea, and like Chip's suggestion of having mob pictures inserted as well. I'd definitely do more like, RP based minecrafting with a journal if I had these sort of tools in the book.
Wow, yes, I never even tried shift-right-clicking before, and I would totally use this all the time!

Yea I don't know why people like these buttons.
I always die in bedwars because of those button. I recommend that Microsoft (or Mojang) make an option where players can turn it off

This is very annoying, especially when bridging
YES! VERY MUCH NEEDED!!!
I would love that ! Sometimes my OCD really bothers me when playing and I just have to spend a large amount of time trying to organize my items just for them to become messy again

My idea for this is to have a datapacks folder in the game profile directory, and have a button that brings up a selection list on the More World Options screen (like the resource pack list). Bonus points for being able to disable the vanilla pack here too. This would copy them to the world folder, so that the main datapack folder can be updated without changing existing worlds.

On this note, I think it would be a really good idea to also add an integrated method for generating structures to datapacks, rather than having to jump through a load of hoops and have the structures potentially overwrite players' builds when adding the datapack.
This was added! Yeah
